info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 12:33AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Stone, northwestern Independence, southeastern Searcy, southern Izard, eastern Van Buren and Cleburne Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1233 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Thola to near Old Lexington to near Choctaw. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Heber Springs... Mountain View... Clinton... Fairfield Bay... Greers Ferry... Cushman... Mount Pleasant... Shirley... Concord... Higden... Rocky Hill... Gid... Herpel... Sugar Loaf Recreation Area... Lunenburg... Elberta... Thola... Fairfield Bay Marina... Claude... Brandenberg... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for north central Arkansas.
